dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We open on a GUARD sitting in front of a sentry post. He wearing a heavy fur hat that covers his ears and a milita jacket. Behind him is a list of instructions (in Russian) He 'sucks in a cigarette as though he's a drowning man lo for oxygen. A CAR comes to a stop by the sentry post, the guard looks, asks a couple of questions and is given an -envelope which he quickly examines, he then attempts to his head in the car. A gun barrel is promptly stuck in hi face and a couple of angry words emanate from the back, t guard jumps back and quickly raises the barrier. This next section will be intercut with the credit sequen В«В·'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the back seat is FRANKY FOUR -FINGERS, (New York stree wise Jew) who is clutching a fancy looking briefcase whic is handcuffed to his wrist. He is flanked by TWO RUSSIAN HOODS. This next section will be subtitled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much further do we have to go? Just then the car comes to a standstill. The window is wo down and a gun barrel is stuck through. The RUSSIAN DRIVE looks dramatically calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pass him the money. Franky hesitates for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Franky you know you have no choice. So please can we get on with it? Franky knows discussion is futile. He flips the case open and pulls out a transparent plastic bag full of American dollars. The package is pulled out of the window, the dri doesn't move, we dissolve for a passage of time, the anxi is more than obvious, but Four Fingers can do nothing. Al of a sudden a package comes through the window and the ca speeds off without waiting for an inspection of the deliv

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Franky opens the package and he reveals a stone the size a fist. He shines a torch onto it and puts a stone inspec monocle to his eye. He's satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: ON FOR THE DURATION OF THE CREDITS. CUT BACK TO
dialogues.text: Franky Four Fingers opens a fancy case, presses a hidden catch, this reveals a second wall within the case, he the carefully places the stone within this secret compartment and firmly closes the case. The Russian next to him is playing with a revolver, he spins the chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Boris?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Heavy is good. Heavy is reliable. If it doesn't work you can hit him with it. Tommy practices a couple of gun slinging maneuvers. He's impressed. At that moment the door opens and in walks a M carrying two heavy sacks of coins. He's a rough looking bastard, he's massive, and extremely ugly. Meet GORGEOUS GEORGE.

Tommy implies he should le Gorgeous isn't too bright and continues to stand there lo stupid. Tommy goes to turn around but can see that he has left, so he turns back,

dialogues.text: Not too bright but he hits like a train. OK I ' l l take it. You're a gambling man Boris, so I'll toss you for it. Heads it's mine, tails I'll give you twice the price. Boris chews this for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Sure, yeah, I like dogs.   I like caravans more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We open on Vinny's dog, now sitting in a car, it's breath heavily and doesn't look well, and Sol doesn't see the fu side of the dog sitting next to him. The man driving is called TYRONE: he's a white guy who thinks he's black. Vi is also in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want him dribbling on my             , seats man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give him another of those biscuits. They shut him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They give him wind. Tyrone turns round to complain, and narrowly misses a car

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey watch the road! Fuck me, you want this man to drive us Sol? Can you drive mate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Vin, he can't tell the difference between a steering wheel and a man . on the moon. That' s why I got him. Sol gives the dog another biscuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you worry about me, jus worry about the dog on my seats man! Tyrone gets out of the car to put some petrol in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sol why's he talking like a black man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know Vin. Oi Tyrone, Vin wants to know why you talk like a black man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roots and ting, seen? Sol and Vin raise their eyebrows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roots and what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. You get that gun from Boris?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it. It wasn't exactly what I was expecting, mind. Mean looking bastard though, that's for sure. Sol unzips a bag.     Inside is a ridiculously powerful s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a shotgun Sol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I t ' s a fuckin anti-aircraft gun Vin. What are you planning on shooting, the angels out of the clouds? That's gonna raise more than pulses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will raise hell my old son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I really want to see В· hell Vin. What's wrong with a normal gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The are psychological advantages to a gun that looks like it can perforate the moon.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Tyrone gets into the car, starts it up again and puts som money in the car wash machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you get this fuckin dog to stop dribbling on me? Vin pulls the dog back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I worry about you Vin, Jesus, talk about overkill. One look at a crack desperate brother and you could wave a knife and fork around, and I am sure they would lick the salt of your scrotum. The car wash starts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never do a job unless I have a clean car, I like to make my wheels look crisp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you serious,? You' re a getaway driver, you're not here to show your fuckin car off.               В·В·. The machine starts. They do the windows up and that point the dog lets out a fart. The water starts to hit the windshield so they can't undo the windows. There is more atmosphere of disbelief than of concrete anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gorgeous George fastens the caravan to the back of their Land Rover and pulls away. They wave at Micky and he reciprocates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a good dog. He'll get a little homesick for a while but he'11 get over it. Tommy has a dog that looks distressed about leaving Micky sitting next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what all your fuss was about. They aren't bad fellas. Just then the wheels of the caravan come straight off and the caravan is dragged until the car comes to a sudden st The dog jumps out the window and goes bounding back to th campsite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are looking at the damage.   Of course i t ' s compl useless now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think it's supposed to have done that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dog is behind Micky's legs happy to be back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The deal was you bought it how you saw it. Tommy goes to interrupt but he doesn't get a chance

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I have helped ya as much as I am gonna help ya. You still got a car and I suggest you use it before you're not welcome anymore. There is a silence for a while. The atmosphere has gone more than frosty and a few more gypsies are hanging aroun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... Interrupted

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was only a question of time before you got some attention. Nobody brings a fella the size of you unless they are trying to say something without talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just give us my money and you can keep your caravan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why the fuck do I want a caravan that's got no fuckin wheels? I am not going to do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gorgeous George steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the fuck do you think you're going? You want to settle this with a fight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll do no such thing Michael. You'll...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright Mum, we shan't, we'll settle it some other way, now don't get upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't have you fighting, Micky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Micky's Mum is getting upset and it's consequently upsett Micky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay mum okay. You need to sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Micky calls to one of the lads standing by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren look after Mum. Get her sitting down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Mum being led out by Darren; Micky looks genuinely concerned for his mum. Pause as Micky waits for her to be well gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ' l l fight you for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy looks at Gorgeous George.        Gorgeous George ra eyebrows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two fighters start pacing. It looks a bit ridiculous, Micky is dwarfed by comparison. Gorgeous George takes a swipe: it was an .impressive punch, but Micky is a quick bastard and sidesteps. Micky does nothing to retaliate; h hands are still by his,side.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Gorgeous George lunges out and grabs Micky by the throat groin, picks him up like a sack of spuds and throws him against the car door. All eyes are on Micky for a second two, then he rises and appears little bothered by this, h gets up brushes himself off and starts to pace again, har even looking at the big man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to stay down my friend, I promise you, you want to stay down. Micky ignores this and continues to pace, the big fella g him and puts him in a headlock and charges him into the s door. There is a terrible noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you fucking stay down boy or you won't be coming up next time. It appears as though this is going to get messy and any h that might have been around has now evaporated. Micky rai his head there is still no damage to speak of. All of a sudden he starts jumping up and down like he's warming up throwing a few shadow punches, taking off his shirt. This reveals a heavily tattooed and scarred torso, and underne these embellishments is a physique that warrants some res

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is sick. I am outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going anywhere my friend. You stay until the job is done. Micky starts pacing, and throwing out a couple of shadow punches with his back to Gorgeous George, he still hasn't really acknowledged his opponent. Gorgeous George moves i for the coup de grace, Micky spins on his feet and catche the big man under the jaw.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO BLACK
dialogues.text: FADE IN: We see Gorgeous George lying on the floor with a head the size of a water melon. There is blood streaming out of every orifice in his head - he's in.big trouble. W are in slow motion;- there's a lot of activity going on a the body on the floor, their mouths are open but we can't hear what they are saying, all we can hear is the voice o given by Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't good, if George doesn't wake up in the next few minutes I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: have a problem. I am scared, really fuckin scared. There is something coldblooded and practical about what these people are thinking. They will pop me like a hot sausage if George doesn't wake up. Why do they want to go to the trouble of explaining why a man died in a campsite? These people don't exist in society, you can't find them, they live under their own laws and ignore everybody else's. I am scared, I am really fuckin scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Turkish with a somewhat serious expression on his face he has his customary pint of milk on one side, he ta a sip and "ohhhs" and "arrrs" for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're telling me he would have run you through if Gorgeous hadn't woken up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, his Mum stopped it. If his Mum hadn't turned up, well, I ' d be pikey fuckin sausages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you thinking of? Why the fuck did you put Gorgeous George into a bare knuckle boxing match two days before he had to fight the Bomber?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was half his size. He pantomimes a man that would reach his navel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't expect him to get hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You put the man into a bare knuckle boxing match. He raises his voice

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck did you expect? A grease down and a shiatsu?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who took the jam out of your donut?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You took the fuckin jam out of my donut Tommy, you did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said get a good deal so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me the correlation between a hospitalized boxer and a good deal? Pause there is no correlation as Tommy knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are we going to explain to Brick Top that his fight isn't going to              . happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We replace the fighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh what, and hope he doesn't notice? And who the fuck are we going to replace him with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John "The Gun?" Or "Mad Fist" Willy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not exactly Mr Current Affairs, are you Tommy? Mad Fist went mad, and the "Gun" shot himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Clam Hand Tony?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got his fingers caught in the till. He's no good to anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bare .knuckle boxer isn't a lot of good without any fuckin knuckles, Tommy. Pause for thought, then Turkish has the look of a man tha has come across a really bright idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's use the fuckin pikey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug the Head and Franky Four Fingers are doing a deal. Doug has a case open and is admiring a couple of stones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From Russia with love. You interested?                                .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you I was interested. Pause.   Franky's in a rush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got stones to sell, fat to chew and many different men to see about many different dogs, so if I am not rushing you, could you spit shine the top of your smoothie and move a little faster?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold tight Franky, when in Rome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not in Rome Doug, I am in a rush. He looks at his watch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta make the bookies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bookies? What you betting on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some guy called Bomber Harris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The unlicensed boxer? You know something I don't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug raises his eyebrows

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get busy Franky. Put a couple of hundred down for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much you going to pay us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten k.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lose more than that running for the bus. I ' l l do it for a caravan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No a caravan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are sitting in one if that makes things easier. I want a top caravan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was us that wanted a caravan.- Anyway what's wrong with this one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not for me, it ' s for me Mum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug is on the phone to Hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I overpaid Hands, I want you to recognize charity when i t ' s offered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do shut up, where is he now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know Hands, I ' m not his mother. But I am seeing him later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants cash so he's coming back after he has been to a fight. There is a serious expression of alarm on Hands's face - camera crashes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean a fight, you mean a boxing match? Is there gambling involved?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I t ' s a boxing match Hands. Hands isn't happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he have a case with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he's gone gambling? That's Franky "I have a problem with gambling" fuckin Four Fingers, you are talking about Doug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I, telepathic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Franky is good at buying stones Doug but he's a fuckin liability when it comes to gambling. That has cost me. So in turn rit' s cost him. He gets distracted and chopping off a digit seems to focus his attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much can he lose? Hands pulls a face like "what kind of a stupid question i that?" He them starts to shout

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ' l l not forgive you Doug, I am coming over, get me that car. The phone is slammed down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the undercarriage of Concorde taking off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy and Turkish walk into a pub and approach the BARMAN They reach the bar.    .            .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are here to see Brick Top. The barman looks them up and down a bit.      He's not do anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am very busy at the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not asking you to break sweat, . I am asking you to call Brick Top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brick Top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never heard of him. . ... : TURKISH               :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well make a call and see if someone else has. Say it's Turkish. The barman looks bothered by the fact he has to move but wanders off. Turkish looks at the pool table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what he's done to people on that pool table?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both give the table an eyeball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, potted more balls than any other player? What else can you do to people on a pool table?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite a fuckin lot if you nail 'em to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO HEAVY LOOKING FELLAS appear out of the woodwork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You Turkish?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup.   -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The heavy fella opens up the bar and beckons Turkish and Tommy through. They go through another door and the corri turns into a mass of dogs barking, snarling 'and whining cages. The mood is sinister..they reach another door, the open up and we are introduced to a dog fight. A load of HEAVY GEEZERS are commenting on the performance of the do one dog is being carried out by a single leg, it's covere in blood. Another dog is left in the ring, it too is cove in blood but it's survived.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can charm the paint off walls these fellas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A circle of blunt faces are exchanging money with one ano A few faces turn round to examine Tommy and Turkish, they frown slightly but carry on about their business once the see they are accompanied by the muscle. The heavy walks over to Brick Top. The heavy taps him on the shoulder and whispers. He acknowledges, and gives his drink to the heavy. He walks over. There is a cage next t Brick Top which has a pit bull in, and Brick Top who is carrying a cane pokes it through the cage doors. The dog snarls back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look mean now you hairy fucker won't ya? He looks at the appalled faces of Turkish and Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shits itself when you put it in the ring, but poke .it with a stick and watch his bollocks grow. You like a dog fight, Turkish?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like my dog to growl at the post man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gorgeous ready for tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don'c have a Gorgeous anymore. Brick Top turns round and indicates that he would like th noise around him to drop. It does marginally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to have to repeat that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have lost Gorgeous George. Brick Top turns round again at the already subdued crowd, doesn't raise his voice but the crowd reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said keep the noise down.. . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tangible silence between the men reflects Brick Top's authority.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, where did you lose him? He isn't a set of fuckin car keys is he? And it's not as though he is inconfuckinspicuous is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not backing out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can bet your bollocks to a barn dance you're not backing out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are changing the fighter. Brick Top wasn't expecting anything out of Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh fuck me your lady friend has got a voice. And who might you be changing him to, sweetheart?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't know him. Pause: a look of you're kidding comes over his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you taking the piss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, there was an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll show you a fuckin accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've still got your fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I lose all bets at the bookies. You can't change fighters at the last minute, so no, I don't have my fight do I, you fuckin prat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could take bets at the fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put a lead on her Turkish,     Before she gets bitten. Pause

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make sure your man goes down in the fourth. You're on thin fuckin ice my pedigree chums and I'll be there if it breaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The black guys pull up in'Tyrone's car outside the bookie Vin is playing with the dog in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not happy about that dog Vin, you can't bring a dog on a job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't leave him on his own, not to begin with, he gets homesick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Homesick, for fucks sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does. If he gets the chance he runs back to the gypsies' campsite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohh shut up, how can he find it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know Sol, I am not a dog. Ask him. It' s like he's got a fuckin homing beacon. Give him the chance and he's off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going soft Vin? Here pass me a sandwich. Vin throws a sandwich to Sol but the dog catches it whils i t ' s in flight and swallows it in one gulp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessssus, he didn't even chew it. The car has stopped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have you stopped here for? What's wrong with that space?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about, tight? You could land a jumbo fuckin jet in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave him alone, he's a natural.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrone gets a little over-excited with the accelerator an reverses with a crashing sound into the rear of the van b them (ie it:s parked back to back with them).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A natural fuckin idiot.    Tyrone, what have you done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you hassle me, see what happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrone makes to move the van forward again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well don't move it now, otherwise people will see the damage. What did you do that for?                        ^

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't see it there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eh? It's a four ton truck. It' s not as though i t ' s a ferret fuckin a flea is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was at a funny angle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vin is confused as to this last statement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny angle? It was behind you Tyrone, whenever you reverse things come from behind you. I am not happy Sol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - The dog starts whining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give him something to shut him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sol throws a plastic squeaky dog ball that was in the fro The dog grabs in and swallows it in one gulp. The brother look on in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't swallow a whole ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He swallowed it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dog looks up having completed the task. Vin who looks quite alarmed holds the dog by the ribs and squeezes, the is a squeak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug and Alex are waiting to pick- up Hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get Hands that car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got him one like it. Doug is in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean one like it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got him the Volante.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I say? What exactly did I say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said get him the Vantage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, I clearly said get him the Vantage. So why did you get the Volante?                                      ;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because they look the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Septuagint scholars mistranslated the Hebrew word for "young woman" in to the Greek word for "virgin", because they thought they looked the same, coming up with the prophecy "behold a virgin shall conceive and bear a son". But there is a world of difference between a virgin and a young woman like there is between a Volante and a fuckin Vantage. '.Pause: she thinks about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you saying that the fact that your cousin Hands is driving a Valiant instead of a Vantage is a profound a mistake as a whole religion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I fuckin am!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cars are his religion. He can drive a Valiant in the States but I can't drive a Vantage because they won't tolerate the emissions. Well, it's too late now, that's Concorde.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands and his sidekick Rosebud are coming out of the slid glass doors towards Doug who's now standing by the car wi his arms crossed. Hands is quite clearly looking for a ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about a hug for your old cousin Doug?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops looking for his car and focuses on Doug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck off you fat bald bastard - and where's my car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The black guys are sitting in the car still.         The squeak comes from the dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How am I going to get it out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll probably cough it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think he'll be alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sol shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we waiting for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are waiting for a man carrying a case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because the deal is that we give the Russian the case and we keep the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rubs his fingers symbolically together

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's in the case?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sol turns round to talk to Tyrone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin 'ell Tyrone you ask a lot of questions. You concentrate on the driving okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back just as a MAN is stepping into the bookies: is carrying a case.

dialogues.text: You got some front coming round here ain't ya Tony?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind what I got , I am looking for Brick Top?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean Mr Mclean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know who I mean you fucking fringe now find him. Pause: the barman looks truculent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chop chop. The barman walks down the end of a bar and picks up the p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was it you did exactly Tony?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a little run in with a few of the chaps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How ' s that ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all brainless, they got white powdered angels sitting on their shoulders telling them what was what, all too busy. . .

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He sticks his finger by the side of his nose and inhales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they weren't sniffing the dust they where flicking the ash. And never trust who puts anything other than a finger up his nose. KEN, another of Brick Top's men, appears from somewhere a approaches Tony with another heavy, SEAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow me. They do and end up in a corridor. The door .shuts behind them and the door in front hasn't yet opened. Ken turns around and faces Tony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know that it was my cousin Lorrie you stabbed? There is a pause.    The situation is volatile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I know I stabbed a man called Lorrie, but no I didn't know he was related to a tub a shit. Ken knows it's on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut that door Sean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lock that fuckin door Sean. BTT takes a step forward and puts his hand, into the back his trousers. He starts to growl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a big man, but I don't care if you're ten foot fuckin tall, you still got eight pints of blood and you'll bleed like any bastard. And . when.I drop .ya, and I will fuckin drop ya, I'll open you up like a packet of crisps. Pause to take in what has just been said then he continue

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a bully Ken, but remember, I am a bigger bully.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The door opens and they are interrupted by another HEAVY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha, Ken what' s going on? Bring em through. The governor wants to see em. Ken is relieved by the interruption, and he leads the way with a truculent "you're lucky" stare. They enter Brick Top's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta say you have got some front coming round here Tone, you know the lads are picking straws. . . Interrupted

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta diamond and it doesn't belong to you, it belongs to my colleague here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I love about you Tone, no small talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said we should come round and raise fuckin hell, you know shoot a few of the boys and that, but he said he thinks we would have more success if we paid for it. So I am going to have a drink and let you two discuss what you have to discuss. Btt walks to the bar.   Ken is sitting there with Sean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright big man, I hope you aren't bitter about your cousin Lorrie. If you listen carefully, you will hear a slight zip of fl being undone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know you're alright when they're are talking business, I ' d like to see you gob off outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohh do me a favour Ken, you've always been mouth and no trousers.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: We cut back to Brick Top and Hands

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I 'l l pay for it, I won't pay you the top fuckin whack but you'll never get that anyway. You got it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't sell you something I haven't got now can I? BTT returns to them - there is a scream from Ken

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a dead fuckin man. You listen to me Tony you're a dead fuckin... Brick top frowns at Ken, and Ken shuts up quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do to upset Ken, Tony? Tony shrugs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's pissed in my fuckin pocket, look! Ken shows off a wet-sided jacket and a damp set of trouse

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do shut up Ken.   That was a bit naughty Tony. Tony shrugs. Brick Top puts his hands in to his pocket an withdraws the stone. We cut to Hand's expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well come on, let's have a look. Brick Top passes the stone to Hands. All goes quiet while everybody focuses on the stone. Hands lifts it up to his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you playing at? - He drops the stone: it smashes on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a zirconia. We crash track in to Brick Top's expression of shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four black guys are trying to pick the lock of the va having been locked in it by Bullet Tooth, Hands and Doug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I changed the stone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I changed it. I know Brick Top knows nothing about stones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes but Doug the fuckin head does!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah well I didn't expect them to lock us up in here did I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohh your one clever bastard Vin, you really are. Where is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's at Lincoln's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck's it doing at my place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waiting for us to pick it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happen if they find that it's a fake stone Vince?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well we are going to get fucked Sol what do you think is going to happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohh yes you are going to get fucked Vince.                 -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A distant voice is shouting

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oi Micky.   Oi Micky.

dialogues.speaker: ' INT. VAN
dialogues.text: We fade out of black to Micky's pov. Thisis shot in slow motion. Micky opens his eyes, in the backof.a large van, there is only one faint light that moodilyilluminates his tired eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You feeling alright Micky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've felt better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are nearly there. They are a horrible bunch this lot Micky so pay attention to what you are doing. Micky just yawns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put up some kind of a show, he's a hard bastard this "good night" Anderson so don't get too clever, he used to be a pro. Just keep moving round the ring, and let the odd one go when push has come to shove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get on with it, shall we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A temporary ring has   been erected, four scaffolding pos with welded on hoops   make the arena, the ropes that are threaded through the   hoops are industrial nylon and fre padding. Around the    ropes it's starting to fill. Brick approaches Salt Pete   and Jack 'the all seeing eye'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope we gonna get a better show this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This will make up for it.     Micky's going down in the fourth.     Terry over there is in charge of   the bets. Now you'll have to forgive   me. Brick Top leaves with Ken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have we got the lads at the- camp site?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah they are there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut to a shot of some of Brick Top's heavies waiting in a car outside the campsite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's that fuckin pikey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brick Top is standing in front of Micky whose eyes are st semi open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with you? You stoned? Is he fuckin stoned?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's like that before a fight. He turns his attention to Micky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you know when you're going down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course he knows when he's going down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey fuck face, who's speaking to you? He asked him didn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck face? I like that, I ' l l have to use that one next time -I want to impress your mum Ken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fourth... or was it the fifth..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a campsite full of pikies that might not think you're so fuckin funny when they 'are putting the flames out on their children's backs. Cut to a shot of Brick Top's boys lighting a cigarette in the car outside the pikies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Micky appears from a small door at the back of the wareho He approaches the ring accompanied with shouts of encouragement and counter shouts. He's wearing a pair of semi cut tracksuit bottoms and a t-shirt with grease mark down the front. Turkish walks behind him, Micky still loo bored. He climbs into the ring. Then from the same door a the one through Micky came out walks a larger character w a nose that appears to have seen countless rounds with a frying pan: HORACE 'GOOD NIGHT1 ANDERSON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright lads no eye gouging no biting. Do your worst. Back to your corners. We drift again into Micky's pov, his world is becoming mo and more surreal. He can faintly hear Turkish whispering words to him, but he's not really listening. A bell comes from somewhere, and Micky instinctively walks to the cent of the ring. "Good night" is already there, they pace one another for a second or two, Micky avoids a punch or two then he takes a hard one and he knows it, we flash to whi Micky's in trouble: he lets one of his missiles go and BA it shakes "good night" to his core, all goes quiet. We go to super slow motion: his knees buckle and "good night" i in trouble. Micky maintains a frown as he watches his opponent's knees threaten to betray him. The crowd tries digest what is happening. After a period of silence reali dawns. Brick Top mouths the words in silence."Don1t go do you fucker". The crowd wants Micky to finish the job. But common sense reins back the coup de grace. "Good night" eventually regains control of his legs and stumbles forwa after a few sleepy punches he starts to provide a serious onslaught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like the look of this Tommy, bring the van up to the back door. This goes on for two rounds (which is montage down to a f seconds). We go in the mind of poor Micky. We break the music just as it's starting to look dangerous... The bell goes and Micky walks to the wrong corner. Turkish pulls h back to his corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are on ya. You got to hurt him Micky. Otherwise we are rumbled.... you hear me Micky? Do -something, it looks like it' s rigged. Micky goes out again his hands are low, BANG there is a f of white as Micky goes down in the dirt. Dust rises from where he fell. He gets up quickly, his hands are still lo BANG he goes down again, in no time he's up.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BANG: he hits the ground again and this time when he hits the deck, he penetrates the dust covered floor, like i t made out of water. He falls through the water like he's sinking; his eyes are open and he can't breathe, he conti to fall, but he's unpanicked (he is now Micky 1). When Mi 1 looks up he can see himself in the corner of the ring t kidney punches from Good Night, he's winded and only semi conscious (this is Micky 2). Micky 1 makes the effort to swim up and tries to penetrate the floor but he's stuck h can't get through. Micky 2 takes more punishment in the ring, as Micky 1 ' s hand continues to try to break the underside of the floor but it stretches like rubber and f Micky 1 down again. Micky 1 looks up again and sees how much trouble Micky 2 ' s in the ring. Micky 1 is panickin now, he's running out of oxygen and Micky 2's being beate Micky 1 starts -to sink again but now flames tickle the b of his feet he looks up. and sees Micky 2 being smashed t hell, his body eventually collapses and Micky 2 falls thr the floor. And as the latter falls through, Micky 1 manag to rise from the depths and his punch manages to perforat the surface. The punch continues its trajectory and has t power to fell a red blooded rhino.... it catches "Good Ni on the jaw and it's good night for "Good Night" it's unli that he'll awake in the next hour. Dear oh dear everybody is in trouble. Again we cut to the reactions of the relevant parties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy get the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have it, it's waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turkish jumps into the ring and grabs Micky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are off Micky, hold tight, and move quickly. ,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turkish pulls Micky away. It's not as hard as it might be trying to get out, because the crowd seems to have found own disputes, chairs start to fly. Brick Top's boys are frustrated in the mayhem. Brick Top calmly dials into his mobile telephone. It rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you would you like to speak to your friends, you'll have to speak a little -louder.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: We pull back to see four slumped heads in the car and blo staining the windscreen. Brick Top calmly puts the phone down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right lets get outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brick Top is looking every which way and trying to get ou of there, accompanied by Ken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the car Ken?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I t ' s coming now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come out of a side entrance, their car pulls round t corner and screeches to a halt. Brick Top opens the door he is about to get in, he's eyes widen to the size of sau as FOUR MEN (who we recognize from the wake) are sitting the place of his driver. They both have sawed-off shotgun and empty four barrels into the chest of Brick Top and Ke The car spins away, leaving their twitching bodies on the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands, Doug and Bullet Tooth have Vin, Sol and Bad Boy Li in tow. They look at the front room of Lincoln's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very nice Lincoln.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Veeeery nice Lincoln.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well where is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They open the door. 123   INT. BAD BOY LINCOLN'S SITTING ROOM. This room is a complete mess. All the colony leather has been chewed up beyond recognition. They all grimace at th smell. The dog comes running up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look what your dog's done to my leather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a bit funky in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BTT opens a window.       The dog looks extremely relieve someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You keep a good house Lincoln.      So where's this stone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to a pile of chewed up cushions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We left it in a box over there... somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks over and finds the remains of the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I t ' s empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear oh dear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not fuckin about, we left it there. It must be in the dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes focus on the dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well let's have a look shall we? . . . . Tn . oy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes focus on Tony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a vlook in the dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean have a look in the dog?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean open him up..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony is not sure about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I t ' s not a fuckin tin of baked beans, what do you mean open him up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean open him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands does a movement that represents a knife across the throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a bit strong isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't have a problem if it was a person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's not, it's a dog and I have never done a dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My heart bleeds. There is another pause

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What dp I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me take a wild and reckless guess. Stick a knife in his guts and see if it's got a diamond in there? I'll hold it still and'you open it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony looks positively unsure and rocks his head from side side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin hell, alright then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well do it to you as well if it makes you feel any better. Cut to Tony having some problems trying to get hold of th awkward dog. The dog starts to squeak. Tony passes the blade to Hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I t ' s squeaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, you've never heard a dog squeak before?... Hold him still. The dog isn't sure about this either.      Vin is in a pa suddenly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! I can see it.   I can see the stone. Hands at the point of entry stops. Vinny hops over to the stone and picks it up. Tony lets the dog stand but keeps grip oh the collar. The dog is relieved to be semi-libera Hands is still on his knees armed with an incredulous sta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well let's see it. Vinny holds it up. There's a sense of relief. He then thr the stone, it cuts through the air. And the dog seeing .another projectile runs to intercept it. There's a pause while all now focus again on the dog. This is digested literally and mentally. The dog recognizes all the attent it's receiving. And goes through the motions of swallowin it. Hands attempts an approach. The dog understandably feels uncomfortable about the advancing vanguard and deci emergency action is needed, and seeing the open window launches itself out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pikies have moved overnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well this is where they were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well they aren't fuckin here now are they? And I can't see a dog can you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can't be far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands, BTT and the black guys are back on the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna have to come up with something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then they see some caravans in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the caravans are fastened to the back of cars. Vinny, Sol, BTT and Hands are standing in front of Micky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well he's didn't come back to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he always came back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you might have noticed that we have moved, you should have fed him more, a dog will never leave you if you feed it properly. It was a good dog, he had a little flatulence problem but was a good dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure he's not here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I would have noticed if a fuckin dog was sitting in my caravan don't you? Tommy, Turkish, have you seen a dog sitting in me caravan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't say I have Micky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See there you have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you mind if we have a look around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck's got into you lot? It's only a dog. I'l l give you another one, if it means that much to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vinny, Sol, BTT and Hands descend the steps, they look li children with their toys taken away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better find me that dog, skinny Vinny. One of Micky's kids is on the bottom of the caravan steps the brothers walk by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I looked after your car for ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So aren't you gonna pay me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah bollocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bollocks to you, you tight git.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch your mouth you cheeky shite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah fuck ya. The kid turns away and goes back to squeezing a toy.   Al four of the chaps stop in their tracks. Cut to shot of squeaky toy. We have seen this toy before. Cut to freeze frame of Sol, Vin, BTT and Hands stopped de in their .tracks. They haven't turned to look over their shoulders yet, but their eyes are turning to look. THE END.
